Posts.EditableText:
I'm currently coding a huge application.  One of these sections requires to check whether or not a form is open.  I've tried searching the MSDN Online Code reference, but I couldn't find anything.  Does anyone know how to check whether or not a form is open?

Matthew G.
Posts.HTML:

Posts.EditableText: Just have it so that when you open the form have the .tag set to "OPEN" and when you close the form, set the .tag to "CLOSED". Then check what the .tag is.
Posts.HTML: Just have it so that when you open the form have the .tag set to "OPEN" and when you close the form, set the .tag to "CLOSED". Then check what the .tag is.

Posts.EditableText: Simpsons joke, Homer has invitations to a barbeque printed out. Says something like BYOBB BBBQ, one of the B's meant something extra, the other was just a typo.
